Thus, we have a clear and simple case in which the convictions of the prosecution witnesses, witness was not, were not disclosed when they should have been as a result of inadvertence or oversight. What is the effect of such non disclosure? If a defendant is convicted in evidence of convictions in the part of the prosecution witness, then comes to light? There is no simple and straightforward answer to that question. The answer will depend on the weight of the evidence in the case. And one can see that as an obvious example where non disclosure would have a quite significant impact upon the actual live issues at the trial.
